benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to bundle

covered: Valid Request: Scenarios TC01, TC02, TC13, TC17, TC23, TC24, TC03, TC22, TC25 cover successful updates and state variations with valid payloads.
Non-Existing Resource: TC05 covers 404 when bundle does not exist.
Concurrency/Performance: TC17 (normal load), TC18 (peak load), TC21 (recovery) cover performance and resilience under load and transient failures.
Server Error Handling: TC11 (503 service unavailable) and TC20 (500 internal server error) cover dependency/service and internal error scenarios.

Validation/Bad Input: TC04 (invalid bundleId), TC06 (missing required header), TC07 (malformed JSON), TC08 (missing body), TC09 (extra/unsupported fields), TC12 (SQL injection attempt), TC09 (extra fields) cover input validation and error handling.
Edge Cases: TC14 (max value length), TC15 (empty value), TC16 (unexpected URL param), TC19 (special characters) address specific boundary and input validation scenarios.
Backward/Compatibility: TC25 covers compatibility with older clients.
State Variation: TC22 (no existing fields), TC23 (update existing), TC24 (partial update) verify behavior under bundle customFields state changes.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination behavior, which is not typically relevant for PUT on a single bundle, but guideline asks to consider pagination for large datasets; explicit pagination tests are missing in this suite.
Caching Behavior: No tests cover HTTP caching semantics (ETag, Cache-Control) for PUT operations.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests verify system behavior under rapid successive requests or rate limiting.
Non-Authorized Access (403): Although 401 is tested, there is no explicit test ensuring proper 403 handling for authenticated users lacking permissions.
Large Payloads: While there are payload-size boundary tests (max fields), explicit large payload stress testing beyond typical maximums is not shown.

Explicit race-condition/concurrency correctness: While TC18 touches concurrency under load and TC21 recovery, explicit race-condition scenarios for simultaneous updates to the same bundle are not clearly isolated.

Pagination/Empty Data with PUT: There is limited explicit coverage for an empty dataset scenario in the context of PUT beyond removing all custom fields (TC03); broader empty-data behavior tests for PUT are limited.
recommendations: Add explicit caching tests for PUT responses (ETag handling, Cache-Control headers) and verify how updates affect caching behavior.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to ensure proper handling of bursty requests (e.g., multiple rapid PUTs).
Introduce explicit 403 (forbidden) tests to complement the existing 401 (unauthorized) and cover permission-related failures.
Add explicit pagination-related tests only if the PUT endpoint supports result paging in related GET/list operations; if not applicable, document that pagination is not required for this PUT path.
Include a dedicated race-condition/concurrency test scenario that simulates two clients updating the same bundle simultaneously to validate atomicity and last-write-wins semantics.
Add dedicated large-payload stress tests beyond maximum field bounds (e.g., substantially larger payloads than typical max limits) to validate robustness under extreme input sizes.
